intro: Melissa stricta, commonly known as lemon balm, is a perennial herb native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its fragrant, slightly lemon-scented leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are often used in herbal teas and traditional medicine for their calming properties. Melissa stricta is also a valuable plant for pollinators, attracting bees and butterflies to gardens.
